intro: Cyrtandromoea decurrens, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Montiniaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, herbaceous habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Cyrtandromoea decurrens thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is typically found in coastal or arid environments.
